Title: Asian Markets End Higher
Description: Tata Motors gained 2.6%. SBI was up 2.1% while Cipla and ONGC rose 2% each, respectively. L&T, RIL, ICICI Bank, HDFC, and Tata Power all gained in a range between 1% and 1.9%. The broader market was boosted by the Election Commission’s decision to allow ...

Title: Banks look to end fiscal on a gold lending high
Description: In a recent email to its customers, HDFC Bank said it was offering zero processing fees and no foreclosure charges for loans availed under its Sampoorna Bharosa gold loan offer, which is on till the end of the month. After retail lending ...

Title: India gold premiums set to fall further
Description: MUMBAI: Gold premiums in India are expected to fall from current levels of about $30 an ounce after the central bank indicated it is considering removing some of the curbs to trade that have crippled imports. India, the second biggest consumer of gold ...

Title: Markets extend dream run; Sensex, Nifty soar to all-time highs
Description: Mumbai: The benchmark indices of BSE and NSE continued their dream run ahead of polls, scaling new all-time highs on strong capital inflows from foreign funds, expectations of RBI keeping key rates unchanged in the next week's policy meet and a ...

Title: Sensex marks biggest single day fall; rupee strengthens
Description: India’s BSE index posted its biggest fall in a month, ending down for a second consecutive session and continuing to retreat from the record high hit in the previous session as investors pared positions in blue chips such as Reliance Industries.
